intro: Oenanthe lisae, commonly known as the Lisae's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Oenanthe lisae is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
